title: The Circle viewers turn on Tim as he comes clean as Margaret Thatcher fan
text:
Could fans now turn against Tim? (Picture: Channel 4/Getty)

The Circle favourite Tim was an instant hit with viewers thanks to his eccentric personality and lovable demeanor, but now the theology professor has divided viewers by stanning Margaret Thatcher.

During last night’s episode, the contestants were discussing politics, when Tim shook all of Twitter.

‘I adore Mrs Thatcher,’ he said.

He also riled up millions when declared the former Prime Minister ‘got it right’.

In turn, viewers flocked to Twitter to share their dismay (and shock) at the dramatic turn of events.

me watching tim saying he loved thatcher, please don’t ruin it for yourself tim #thecircle pic.twitter.com/8mPwPsswkG — 𝒿𝑜𝒹𝒾𝑒 ✨ (@jcdiet) October 9, 2019

Advertisement

‘I trusted you Tim!’ one exasperated fan fumed.

Another added: ‘Please don’t ruin it for yourself Tim.’

Fans also made the point that Tim, a gay man, showing his support for the former Conservative leader didn’t exactly line up with her stance on LGBT+ rights.

Tim now faces a backlash against viewers (Picture: Channel 4)

‘How can Tim as a gay man say Margaret Thatcher “got it right”?’ one critic asked. ‘When section 28 went through on her watch?

Section 28 was a law passed by Thatcher’s government which made the ‘promotion’ of homosexuality illegal throughout schools and local authorities in Britain.

No Tim.. Thatcher was a terrible prime minister. Her stance on LGBT+ rights was disgusting. #TheCircle — Danny (@r2danny2) October 9, 2019

How can Tim as a gay man say Margaret Thatcher 'got it right' when Section 28 went through on her watch? And he's the favourite?! #thecircle — Sam McFaul (@SamMcFaul) October 9, 2019

Have seriously gone off #TheCircle with the amount of Thatcher sycophants in there. Tim especially. An educated, articulate, intelligent gay man who lived through that era, and he's a Thatcher fan-boy? The failure of the British education system laid bare to see. — Sal (@muddyringlets) October 10, 2019

Of course, some fans still supported Tim, and praised the 58-year-old for speaking his mind.

If you liked Tim but now don’t because he liked Thatcher then you need to have a long hard look at yourself in the mirror. You can like someone who has different political views to you #TheCircle — Neil Monnery (@neilmonnery) October 9, 2019

I don't care on the Tim Thatcher stuff.. no one is perfect, he is still the best by a country mile + at least he has been open and honesty throughout which is more that can be said for most of the others #TheCircle #Backstabbers — Danny Jackson (@JustDanny92) October 9, 2019

Eagle-eyed viewers also yesterday uncovered a tragic story from Tim’s past as his partner Necati opened up about a traumatic event from his past.

Tim was also one of the only players to successfully guess that the dumped Beth and Jack were catfishing the group as ‘Joyce.’

The Circle airs weekdays from 10pm on Channel 4.
